text: Twenty-year-old tour guides, dressed in traditional kimonos, visit Tokyo’s Meiji shrine on Friday to attend a purification ceremony with a Shinto priest to mark Japan’s ‘Coming-of-Age Day’. Young people turning 20 are officially recognised as adults in Japan. As tour guides are busy working on the ‘Coming-of-Age Day’ celebrated on January 11, the ceremony was organised for them in advance.— Photo: AFP
title: Finery for a special day
